pullRequest.body:
Co-authored with Valeria de Paiva. This defines the category `Dial(C)` which is a categorical interpretation of Gödel's "Dialectica interpretation" of higher order arithmetic.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [b22c23796a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14274/commits/b22c23796aa1eb9d873956ae7e724085a7f649c1)

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Dial`
`+ Hom`
`+ associator`
`+ associator_naturality`
`+ braiding`
`+ braiding_naturality_left`
`+ braiding_naturality_right`
`+ comp_le_lemma`
`+ hexagon_forward`
`+ hexagon_reverse`
`+ hom_ext`
`+ instance : Category (Dial C)`
`+ instance : MonoidalCategory (Dial C)`
`+ instance : MonoidalCategoryStruct (Dial C)`
`+ instance : SymmetricCategory (Dial C)`
`+ isoMk`
`+ leftUnitor`
`+ leftUnitor_naturality`
`+ pentagon`
`+ rightUnitor`
`+ rightUnitor_naturality`
`+ symmetry`
`+ tensorHom`
`+ tensorObj`
`+ tensorUnit`
`+ tensor_comp`
`+ tensor_id`
`+ triangle`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

While I'm happy to see monoidal closed categories being used for something I know nothing about, I also know nothing about the dialectica category!

Might you, or perhaps Valeria, be able to say something here or in the module-doc about what this will be used for? (Or if this will be a leaf node in Mathlib?)

I think it would be nice to include a constructor for isomorphisms in `Basic.lean`, something like
```lean
@[simps]
def isoMk {X Y : Dial C} (e₁ : X.src ≅ Y.src) (e₂ : X.tgt ≅ Y.tgt)
    (eq : X.rel = (Subobject.pullback (prod.map e₁.hom e₂.hom)).obj Y.rel) : X ≅ Y where
  hom := { f := e₁.hom, F := π₂ ≫ e₂.inv, le := sorry }
  inv := { f := e₁.inv, F := π₂ ≫ e₂.hom, le := sorry }
```
(I am not completely sure what is the most convenient phrasing of `eq` here.)

Then in `Monoidal.lean`, definitions would be easier because only one compatibility would be necessary:
```lean
/-- Left unit cancellation `1 ⊗ X ≅ X` in `Dial C`. -/
@[simps!]
def leftUnitor (X : Dial C) : tensorObj tensorUnit X ≅ X :=
  isoMk (Limits.prod.leftUnitor _) (Limits.prod.leftUnitor _) sorry

/-- Right unit cancellation `X ⊗ 1 ≅ X` in `Dial C`. -/
@[simps!] def rightUnitor (X : Dial C) : tensorObj X tensorUnit ≅ X :=
  isoMk (Limits.prod.rightUnitor _) (Limits.prod.rightUnitor _) sorry

/-- The associator for tensor, `(X ⊗ Y) ⊗ Z ≅ X ⊗ (Y ⊗ Z)` in `Dial C`. -/
@[simps!]
def associator (X Y Z : Dial C) : tensorObj (tensorObj X Y) Z ≅ tensorObj X (tensorObj Y Z) :=
  isoMk (Limits.prod.associator _ _ _) (Limits.prod.associator _ _ _) sorry
```

Could you split this PR into two? One for `Basic` and `Monoidal`, and a second one for `Closed`.

> Might you, or perhaps Valeria, be able to say something here or in the module-doc about what this will be used for? (Or if this will be a leaf node in Mathlib?)

I asked Valeria about this and she might be convinced to write some more motivational text in the module doc than I can give (cc: @vcvpaiva), but it seems likely that this will be a leaf node for the foreseeable future.

By the way, Valeria has a repo full of links to other dialectica-related work here: https://github.com/vcvpaiva/DialecticaCategories
After the suggested changes are done and additional documentation at the beginning of the `Basic` file is added, this can be merged.

hi, a proposed additional documentation to be added at the beginning of the Basic file. please feel free to cut it to size, if too verbose.

Dialectica categories are important models of linear type theory. They satisfy most of the distinctions that linear logic was meant to introduce and many models do not satisfy, like the independence of constants. Many linear type theories are being used at the moment--https://ncatlab.org/nlab/show/linear+type+theory describes some of them: for quantum systems, for effects in programming, for linear dependent types. In particular, dialectica categories are connected to polynomial functors, being a slightly more sophisticated version of polynomial types, as discussed, for instance, in Moss and von Glehn's `Dialectica models of type theory' https://arxiv.org/abs/2105.00283. As such they are related to the polynomial constructions being developed by Awodey, Riehl, and Hazratpour. For the non-dependent version developed here several applications are known to Petri Nets, small cardinals in Set Theory, state in imperative programming, and others, see https://github.com/vcvpaiva/DialecticaCategories.
I edited Valeria's paragraph above into the file. Let me know if I should make any additional edits to make it better fit into the standard module doc style.
bors d+

:v: digama0 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9776002767/job/26987624357)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9776002767/job/26987624605)
I believe this is `Functor.monotone` in `CategoryTheory.Category.Preorder`.

The expression `α(u, F(u, y)) ≤ β(f(u), y)` does not fully makes sense to me. At the very least, I find it more confusing. It would be nice to at least say explicitly that this is an inequality in subobjects of `V ⨯ Y`. Also, writing `{ α(u, F(u, y)) } ≤ { β(f(u), y) }` would make things more clear.

Would it be better to use subset notation like `{ (u,y) | α(u, F(u, y)) } ⊆ { (u,y) | β(f(u), y) }`? For me the definition with point-free descriptions of pullbacks is completely impenetrable, and I need to frequently consult this "internal language" version in order to make sense of things. (It's also not an inequality in `V ⨯ Y`, it's in `U ⨯ Y`. I was hoping the choice of letters would make the typing clear.)
This docstring should also be updated.

```suggestion
  /-- This says `{(u, y) | α(u, F(u, y))} ⊆ {(u, y) | β(f(u), y)}` using subobject pullbacks -/
```

This is the standard name we use in multiple other places in category theory:
```suggestion
@[ext] theorem hom_ext {X Y : Dial C} {x y : X ⟶ Y} (hf : x.f = y.f) (hF : x.F = y.F) : x = y :=
   Hom.ext x y hf hF

end Dial

end CategoryTheory
```
Could you add this to the `docs/references.bib` file?

**[lint-bib]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ```

```suggestion
theorem comp_le_lemma {X Y Z : Dial C} (F : Dial.Hom X Y) (G : Dial.Hom Y Z) :
    (Subobject.pullback π(π₁, π(π₁, prod.map F.f (𝟙 _) ≫ G.F) ≫ F.F)).obj X.rel ≤
    (Subobject.pullback (prod.map (F.f ≫ G.f) (𝟙 Z.tgt))).obj Z.rel := by
  refine' le_trans _
    (((Subobject.pullback (π(π₁, prod.map F.f (𝟙 _) ≫ G.F))).monotone F.le).trans
    (le_trans _ (((Subobject.pullback (prod.map F.f (𝟙 Z.tgt))).monotone G.le).trans _)))
  all_goals simp [← Subobject.pullback_comp]
```

```suggestion
  symmetry := symmetry

end Dial

end CategoryTheory
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: the Dialectica category

source.title: feat: the Dialectica category is monoidal closed
